title.narrative: Researching population ageing to support the design of medical reimbursement policies in Shanghai

description.narrative: The project is designed to draw on UK expertise to reveal the relationship between age and medical expenses, and the characteristics of end-of-life expenses among the elderly in Shanghai. Through undertaking a ‘value for money' analysis to identify inappropriate resource use on elderly care in Shanghai, and learning lessons from the UK context, this project will provide a reference for policy design and implementation in Shanghai, both under the 13th Five-Year Plan and through guidance that the Shanghai Municipal Human Resources and Social Security Bureau is due to issue on the Elderly Care Social Security System by the end of 2016. Chinese adoption of UK proposals in the study has the potential to generate opportunities for international businesses, including UK ones.
